attributes.action: Illegal for children under the age of 16 to purchase eggs
attributes.background: Following the recent devastating incidents and criminal damage that has been caused not only in my area but around the country with children throwing eggs at cars, houses and shops has created a big upset.
attributes.additional_details: A young boy has been left critically injured, after a group of children had thrown an egg, from the opposite side of the road, at a cars front windscreen which led the driver to not be able to see where they were going and innocently hitting a young boy, who was trick or treating with his friends, this has left him with a bleed to his brain and not knowing who his mum and other family members were. Just imagine the upset that the family is going through. I pray that Brendan has a speedy recovery

attributes.action: Ban insurance companies from charging administration fees
attributes.background: Insurance companies are charging administration fees for starting/cancelling/amending policies when this work is all automated by the systems they have in place and the price charged is disproportional to the work involved.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies do not incur any extra printing or postage charges to make amendments to policies anymore as everything is online, any changes made are processed automatically through the system, the charges were first introduced to cover the cost of the paper and ink and postage for sending letters.

attributes.action: Increase funding to police forces
attributes.background: As aired on ‘crimewave 2018: a lawless Britain’ 9 out of 10 crimes go unsolved and police lack resources.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has suffered from the increase of crime especially knife crime as well as an increase of burglaries over the past year, this is the result of decreased funding the government has given the police. We now need the government to give police forces in England and Wales enough funds to be able to put more police officers on our streets to keep the public safe and to increase funding. They should also increase funding to Scotland and Northern Ireland so that they can do the same.

attributes.action: Require cash options for day to day expense not force smartphone or credit card.
attributes.background: Our local council is about to remove cash machines from car parks and replace them with machines that take only card or smartphone payments. At the least there should be a cash or prepaid alternative, or a minimum requirement for cash payment facilities to still be available nearby for daily expense
attributes.additional_details: This is an issue for services across the UK and is of particular concern for the elderly and poorest in society. Not everyone can afford a smartphone, have a credit/debit card, or wish essential daily expenses to be handled online or remotely. This is about not discriminating against people with reduced circumstances, and dealing with a real fear by some of building debt with day to day expenses.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to send horses to slaughter.
attributes.background: I have volunteered at local riding schools for a number of years. Horses can be there as a companion for people who feel lonely. They can even be used to help restore confidence for disabled. Horses have been a vital part of our community’s and don’t deserve slaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Through this I have seen how therapeutic horses can be to people. Horses can help reduce stress levels and anxiety. The Riding for disabled (RDA) have used horses to help the disabled find something they can be good at so they don’t feel isolated. Horses were there for soldiers through the war and charged into battle bravely to save their rider and how do we repay them? We send them to slaughter. Thousands of horses are killed each year in UK slaughterhouses.

attributes.action: Stop sanctioning benefit claimants by withdrawing access to money.
attributes.background:
No one in the UK should be left without access to benefits. Sanctions  lead to further poverty which can include loss of homes and sometimes to death.
Losing benefits is not a proportionate response to missed appointments. No one should be denied access to money.
It is time for sanctions to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/one-in-five-benefit-related-deaths-involved-sanctions-admits-dwp/

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2015/aug/27/death-britains-benefits-system-fit-for-work-safety-net

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/benefits-sanction-resulted-in-my-brother-david-clapson-s-death-says-gill-thompson-as-she-pleads-for-a6911386.html

https://edition.cnn.com/2018/11/05/uk/uk-austerity-un-rapporteur-intl/index.html

attributes.action: Give equal child related financial support to all families,not just "low income"
attributes.background: "Low income"families receive an abundance of financial help when they have a child.Tax credits/Maternity grants/benefits/free nursey places etc.With such low maternity pay slashing working household income I believe that all families with young children should receive the same financial help.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the support available for "low income" families.

Maternity grants
Child tax credits
Healthy start scheme
Housing benefit
Free nursery from a younger age than those who are not low income.
Council tax reduction
Etc etc

If you fall above the threshold and receive no help, you can end up worse off than those "low income families" and working harder for it too.

All babies/children deserve the same start/support from our government. We pay into the system, so support us when we need it.

attributes.action: Stop the bedroom tax and stop homelessness increasing.
attributes.background:
The government should stop the bedroom tax and help the vulnerable on
limited budgets. Homelessness is on the increase and this tax is helping
towards those figures due to people not been able to pay for the rent shortfall out of their limited benefits.
attributes.additional_details: With the universal credits system taking 6 weeks before getting paid, the bedroom tax is another expense that people are struggling with and making people homeless.

attributes.action: Require a proper, official unbiased campaign guide for all future referenda
attributes.background: Parliament must require an official, unbiased guide with for-and-against arguments and related rebuttals, a register of organisations in support and opposition, and unbiased explanations of financial consequences of vote outcomes.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament in its sovereignty must protect the people by preventing manipulative and unclear referenda with ill-defined questions, rampant misinformation and misleading promises. We request that our sovereign Parliament implement referenda reform by producing truly unbiased official voter communications document, similar to California Secretary of State?s Official Voter Information Guide.

attributes.action: Apply the rule of law to British Citizens who joined ISIS
attributes.background: British citizens who have been radicalised in our country should be dealt with here. We should not be palming our criminals / victims off to other states.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office 2018 counter-terrorism strategy outlines how to deal with a British woman who travels to join ISIS & has a baby. This should be applied consistently. Please see Tweet from the Secret Barrister. https://twitter.com/BarristerSecret/status/1098139734176686080 

For the rule of law to mean anything, it has to apply to all of us. Including those who would do us the most harm.

attributes.action: A minimum 6 month driving ban for mobile phone use whilst driving.
attributes.background: I am a Class 1 HGV driver and I am sick to death of people texting and phoning whilst driving. I see dozens of people doing this from my high vantage point in a truck everyday. The current punishment is deterring no one. A ban will make the majority change their habits when livelihoods are at stake.
attributes.additional_details: There are many well documented cases of the death and destruction caused by these selfish drivers.

attributes.action: Remove all right to buy legislation (including voluntary RTB) from all  Statutes
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that Social Housing has been and continues to be, damaged by Right to Buy legislation. We believe that this legislation must be removed from Statutory legislation.
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that a high percentage of Social Housing sold under Right to Buy legislation has created a sub market for private landlords which has forced up the cost of welfare rental payments to the detriment of all tax payers.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the press to name people arrested until they've been charged
attributes.background:
As recent events have proven, often the press will name people arrested and snoop into their private lives as well as quiz friends, family and neighbours. There can be no benefit to this especially in high profile cases with global attention. 
 
Require anonymity until a charge has been brought.

attributes.action: Include all delivery services within the regulatory control of Ofcom
attributes.background: As a largely unregulated industry (other than Royal Mail), the services of delivery companies (Yodel, Hermes etc.) seem to be getting worse. I call on the Government to include all delivery services within the regulatory control of Ofcom to ensure standards are met for both consumers and employees.
attributes.additional_details:
2.8 billion packages and parcels were delivered in 2016, a rise of 65% in four years, up from 1.7 billion in 2012. This represents a delivery market in the region of £10.1 billion in 2016. This is expected to grow in 2021 to around £13.2 billion.

Reading reviews of these delivery companies and the services they provide do not, however, make good reading. Deluges of parcels being lost or damaged, passing the buck back to sellers, excluding pretty much every item with a resale value from loss and poor delivery practices coming from pressures on delivery drivers and poor pay.

With even more retailers growing their online sales, this market is due to grow further with no signs of abating. The services being provided need to be properly regulated and companies held to account more easily.

attributes.action: Require payslips to state the holiday gained and remaining
attributes.background: It has been said in the Guardian that UK agency workers lose out on £500m a year in missing holiday pay, but this amount is greater, as it does not include the miscalculations on employees working irregular or in zero hour contracts.
attributes.additional_details:
In this link, you will find the guardian explain that staff working for agencies are earning an average of 22p an hour less than employees for exactly the same work.

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/nov/30/uk-agency-workers-lose-out-on-500m-a-year-in-missing-holiday-pay 

The government page offers a way to calculate holiday entitlement but this system is not fair, as main employees and in some occasions, employers, are losing money with it.

https://www.gov.uk/calculate-your-holiday-entitlement

attributes.action: Change rights for parents that have nothing to do with their children
attributes.background: My daughter’s father has been out of her life since she was 7 months old. I need his consent for me to change her name or to take her out the country.
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken with a lawyer who explained to me that I would need to find him and tell him about the name change and if he does not agree then we go to court, but we have no contact whatsoever. The same was told to me about taking her out of the country. I’m hoping to get something in place where if the dad/Mum is out of their life for 2 or more years then they lose their rights over these things.

attributes.action: CEO total income capped to no more than 60 times the lowest employee income.
attributes.background:
FTSE 100 CEOs are now paid:

•    165 times more than a nurse.

•    140 times more than a teacher.

•    132 times more than a police officer.

I want CEO pay capped to a 60 times ratio of the lowest paid in the company. If they want a pay rise everyone should get one.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.equalitytrust.org.uk/taxonomy/term/136

attributes.action: Include DBS check as a part of aplication for "settled status" after Brexit
attributes.background: This petition calls for adding a Criminal Record  check to the application for "settled status" for citizens of EEA  after Brexit. They should have clean DBS check to receive opportunity to settle down in United Kingdom after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the EU and this could reduce crime rates at no cost to taxpayer. Those who fail to deliver clear DBS should be refused right to settle down in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: £15ph National minimum wage for hgv drivers to be made compulsory
attributes.background:
£15ph National minimum wage for hgv drivers should be made compulsory.
It’s came to my attention that minimum wage has risen for UK workers but HGV drivers wages are still far too low. 
If minimum wage for HGV drivers was set at £15, you would see that the driver shortage would end
attributes.additional_details:
In most cases of HGV driving the average wage is set to £9 a hour. 
This is for 60 hours but for an average 48 over a set period. 60hours -5hours for breaks =£495 a week, that's a lot you would think? let's take into account work life balance ,weekend work, night shifts cpc courses that come out of your free time, 35hours over 5 years .This is a highly skilled job what can keep you away from family all week, stuck in endless traffic jams whilst companies make millions, we keep the UK running.

attributes.action: Prevent a single MP being able to stop a Private Member’s Bill
attributes.background: Change the arcane parliamentary procedure of one MP being able to shout “Object!” to block a potentially viable & widely supported Private Members Bill (like upskirting or FGM protection) and insert better protection mechanism e.g. forcing vote to stop Bill progress or set number objecting.

attributes.action: Make Albanian a GCSE or A Level
attributes.background: There are thousands and thousands of young Albanians and Kosovans across our country, and we have to value this, make 'Shqip' a language you can pick for your GCSE's. England is supposed to be a very multicultural country and we have to value it.

attributes.action: Review personal independence payment screening for Chronic “invisible” illness
attributes.background: Chronic illness such as Crohn’s disease is on a rapid incline and many people are suffering and left unable to work and support themselves and are living on the edge of homelessness day in day out and It would appear that the DWP wish to completely overlook or dismiss such illnesses as we can walk.
attributes.additional_details:
The questions involved are completely irrelevant to illnesses where you can be seen to be able bodied. but illnesses such as Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis as well as many others are being completely overlooked due to reasons such as “you can prepare a meal”, “You can shower and clean yourself.” “You can walk 100 meters” but these factors don’t mean that we can hold down a full time job and in some cases even part time. But more often than not we need support and assistance.

The Government should review whether the PIP process is treating people with invisible illnesses fairly and ensure assessors and questions are suitable.

attributes.action: Create an NHS service equipped to help people with autism & mental health issues
attributes.background:
Many people with Autism struggle to get mental health support despite being 80% more likely to suffer from it!
66% of newly diagnosed individuals have contemplated suicide... this is a ridiculous statistic. 
Change needs to happen!!
attributes.additional_details: I lost my best friend to suicide back in 2015, he had autism and suffered from depression and was on a waiting list for mental health services, however a lot of these services are unequipped and shy away from supporting individuals with autism, because of our communication difficulties. We are often labelled as not engaging due to not being able to verbalise what’s happening as easy as other service users and often get discharged or misunderstood, there needs to be a service that helps us!

attributes.action: Make carers allowance payable to carers after they reach pensionable age.
attributes.background: I have cared for my husband for the last 18+years after he sustained a traumatic brain injury. I had to give up my full time job to do this and now I find that I am going to loose CA  when I  reach pensionable age which I feel is grossly unfair as I am still a full time carer.

attributes.action: Conduct an inquiry into the dispute between TOC's and the RMT.
attributes.background: This Petition Calls upon the relevant Secretary of State to exercise his powers under section 215 of the ‘Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992’ to either conduct an inquiry or to appoint a court of inquiry into the running dispute between Train Operating Companies and the RMT!

attributes.action: Ban overseas state-owned manufacturers from providing 5G core infrastructure
attributes.background: In addition to current devices, 5G will connect millions of autonomous vehicles, drones and billions of IoT devices. Allowing overseas state-sponsored manufacturers to provide the infrastructure which within years will be fundamental to everything is too big a security risk.
attributes.additional_details: Strategic News Service: Behind 5G, 30/11/2018

attributes.action: Scrap free television licences for the over-75s
attributes.background: According to Lord Hall of Birkenhead, the over-75s consume many more BBC services than others, yet are not required to pay for a television licence. This means households that are not eligible for a free licence are being forced to subsidise the over-75s which amounts to age discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: According to TV Licensing there were 4,455,000 over-75s licences in force in 2017. At the current cost of £150.50 per licence, this represents a total cost of £670 million that is covered by households that pay for a television licence.

attributes.action: Zero Hour contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices. 
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: I would like it to be made compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth.
attributes.background: I believe that it is the number 1 human right to know who you are. Technology makes this possible it needs to be compulsory so people don’t find out in adulthood that their biological father isn’t who they thought it was.
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to step in and make it compulsory for a child to have a DNA test at birth and give the child the knowledge of who their fathers are and vice versa
 
The DNA sample should be destroyed and other further information should be taken. The result should be entered on a child's birth certificate.
 
I am a mother and I believe children and men need to know who they are related too. It will takes away doubt and makes for a more confident, honest society, for children to grow up in.

attributes.action: Allow pupils to opt out of music lessons on religious grounds
attributes.background: Some muslims believe Islam forbids them to play musical instruments, listen to music, dance and can not play a role in it. As this subject is compulsory on the National Curriculum, some muslims are being forced to go against their religion by schools.
attributes.additional_details:
As parents we have full right over what information is delivered to our children. Muslims should not have to compromise with anyone on what they believe to be clear cut orders and principles conveyed in their religion. So therefore the subject music should be optional. Evidence from the Holy Book (Quran), Allah SWT, says in Surah Luqman, "And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech [music] to mislead [others] from the way of Allah will have a humiliating
punishment". [Luqman 31:6]

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Require schools to make changes to curriculum and exams for children with SEN
attributes.background: When a children is diagnosed with a learning difficulty by a psychologist they then put in recommendations to the school which the school doesn't or can't put in practice due to cuts in schools. These results from psychologist shouldn't be a recommendation they should be compulsory and funded.
attributes.additional_details: We have been fighting for three years for our daughter to be diagnosed with dyslexia. Now we have, the school has no legal duty to put in recommendations from the psychologist, nor do they have a protocol in place for dyslexia, she has to sit SATs test alongside her peers , yet now has been diagnosed with learning difficulty how can this be fair to the child and true results for the government

attributes.action: Require public transport providers to offer free transport to those in education
attributes.background: Most people who are still in education don't have a well paying job, or don't even have one. This means that travelling around is hard and can be very costly.
attributes.additional_details: We are taking part in a citizenship project and this is our topic/ issue. Not only will this make transport easier for people who are still trying to learn, but also means that the roads are clearer of young drivers. This therefore results in pollution levels from transport decreasing

attributes.action: Ask the Paralympic Committee to move the swimming Championships from Malaysia.
attributes.background: The Malaysian prime minister has publicly stated about how Jews have “hooked noses,” and other anti-Semitic sentiments, states there is “no place for Israeli athletes in Malaysia” following Malaysia’s refusal to grant visas to Israeli athletes in the World Paralympic Swimming Championship.
attributes.additional_details: Sport is a source of uniting people together though different backgrounds regardless of politics, sex, race, religion, and more. To disallow Israeli athletes to perform in the championships is not only an insult to what the Olympics stand for, but also a slap in the face to the benefits Israel has provided to aid paraplegics continue to prosper in their lives by creating products like the ReWalk exoskeleton used during the London Marathon.

attributes.action: Adopt the recommendations of the UN Special Rapporteur on extreme poverty
attributes.background:
Britain is the 5th largest economy in the world and it houses one of the world's key global economic centres.
Despite this, the UN say ⅕th of the population are in poverty, and 1.5 million are destitute.
The government must immediately adopt recommendations made, and rectify the immense harm done.
attributes.additional_details:
The conclusion of the report states that permissiveness of poverty in the UK, especially since 2010, has been a choice. Austerity was opted for with knowledge or ignorance of the fact it would disproportionately affect working class communities, women, disabled and chronically ill people, children and BAME people.

The conclusion lays out simple solutions, such as improving public services, social inclusion and reviewing Universal Credit.

We demand the Government adopt these recommendations.

attributes.action: Law change. No reduced sentence if plea changed after further evidence heard.
attributes.background: For victims reliving evidence can be very traumatic and then seeing the offender getting a reduced sentence is adding more pain. For example, abused children may see the sex offender get shorter sentences as they have pleaded guilty when the child discloses more information about the offence.
attributes.additional_details: There should be no reduction in sentence for a guilty plea made after the victim has given evidence.

attributes.action: Pay child element weekly on universal credit
attributes.background: Help families survive better with young children
attributes.additional_details: Don't need any evidence just look at the state this country is in

attributes.action: Ban non 'diet' fizzy drinks having sweeteners in them
attributes.background:
Since the introduction of the sugar tax companies have been changing recipes for their standard drinks to reduce the amount of sugar by adding sweeteners.
For many people who either do not want to drink a 'diet' drink this has become very confusing and in most cases you cannot buy a drink without.
attributes.additional_details:
An example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). 
Or drinks labled 'Regular' or 'Classic' now contain sweetener although there are already no added sugar or diet versions.

The sugar tax has reduced a consumers choice so it is near impossible to buy a drink without sweeteners and it is already being shown that they cause as much a health risk as too much sugar. 
Moderation is the way forward not lack of choice.

attributes.action: Plant more trees in national parks and local communities!
attributes.background:
By using land that is free from agriculture and future urban expansion to plant trees, we can help Britain lead in combating climate change!

Working with farmers to utilise their free space for more trees, increasing forestland in national parks and working with local councils to help plant trees
attributes.additional_details:
This project would create jobs as well as working with existing companies, could utilise the younger generation into it by offering part time/full time work, or volunteering programmes.

This would help Britain send a message to the rest of the world in one solution for combating climate change. This would be a great investment for our country in so many ways, both short term and long term. 

Let's make Britain green!

attributes.action: Remove 'Mrs' and 'Miss' on all government docs & forms and use only 'Ms' instead
attributes.background: Why is it that women designate their marital status when men don't? It's 2018, this indirect sexism shouldn't be supported by the UK government. 'Miss' and 'Mrs' have no place in this era of equality, let's have them replaced by one single designation 'Ms'; just like 'Mr' and the now disused 'Mstr'.

attributes.action: Do not legislate to renew community radio licences after 15 years - readvertise!
attributes.background: At 15 years we think the question must be asked "is this proposal still the best one out there? Could someone else do better?". Currently community radio licences stop at 15 years and have to be fully readvertised. Politicians are discussing allowing further blind renewals, which we think is wrong.
attributes.additional_details: Originally community radio licences were intended to be awarded for a 5-year term. Parliament then extended this to 10-years, then 15.   However these extensions do not ask the question "Is this the best use of the radio spectrum?". 15 years ago most towns/cities had local radio stations, now most are networked shows. Many community stations also have had changed and for some the original cause/reason no longer even exists. 15 years is enough - ask again who is making the best offering locally?

attributes.action: A minimum prison sentence of 10 years for attempting to meet after grooming.
attributes.background: Too many crimes are being committed against children on a daily basis, these are wrecking their childhoods and are given poor sentences. I want to see a minimum of 10 yrs for attempting to meet a child after grooming. Not suspended and only rehabiltate inside away from our children. Give us justice.

attributes.action: Make guide dogs available as part of the mobility scheme, not reliant on charity
attributes.background: There is nothing more curtailing of your independence and mobility than sight loss, funds should be available via the mobility scheme to train a guide dog rather than people being reliant on charitable funds.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the Metro system in Tyne and Wear
attributes.background: The Metro is a crucial transport service in the North East and represents the Government's failures to fund public transport systems outside major cities such as London or Manchester. The Metro system needs urgent repairs as there are constant delays, system failures and general renovations needed.
attributes.additional_details:
https://twitter.com/My_Metro

The twitter account shows some of the major inconveniences commuters experience on a regular basis. This includes, trains being cancelled, accessibility issues such as lift breakages at major city centre stations and information boards failing to display the correct information. This reflects the need to increase funding for repairs on the nearly 40 year old transport system.

attributes.action: Ban plastic bottled water
attributes.background: There’s 12 years until global warming becomes irreversible. Bottles take huge amounts of fossil fuels to make & transport, adding to global warming which is suffocating the earth. Plastic bottles end up in landfill or infiltrating our streets as litter. Why do this when we can use reusable bottles?

attributes.action: Stop the Exportation of Plastic Waste abroad
attributes.background:
The UK uses 3.3 million tonnes of plastic each year & around two-thirds of that is sent abroad to countries such as Malaysia, & Indonesia with no guarantee that it will be recycled.
Many of these locations do not have the infrastructure in place to deal with plastic & so it ends up in our oceans.
attributes.additional_details:
The government currently have not done enough to proactively investigate the risks to the environment associated with this practice.

According to the Ocean Conservancy, plastic has been found in more than 60% of all seabirds and 100% of sea turtle species.
Ingesting plastic has life-threatening effects on wildlife & this plastic eventually ends up being digested by humans.

The scale of this issue is huge & the UK are contributing to it. Please support the ban on exporting our plastic waste.

attributes.action: Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
attributes.background: Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Introduce paid bereavement leave as an employment right
Losing a loved one is traumatic, stressful & demanding, but there is no legal requirement for employers to provide paid bereavement leave.

This means employers can force people to immediately return to work or go unpaid/use their holiday, which is unacceptable & counter-productive for well-being.

attributes.action: Applications for ILR - Standard service failure should be illegal
attributes.background: Families are facing emotional distress from Home Office delays to process applications with some taking up to 2 years when their standard service is up to 6 months. During this time applicants are restricted on what to do since the passports are kept by HO and there’s no resident residence status.
attributes.additional_details:
The law should be changed so the Home Office can face legal sanctions if they fail to meet their standard service targets.
 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-england-41096675
 
https://www.ein.org.uk/news/independent-increasing-home-office-delays-deciding-settlement-visas-despite-falling

attributes.action: Abolish the statutory fee that is charged when you collect your stolen vehicle.
attributes.background: Whenever a stolen vehicle is recovered by the police, you must pay a statutory fee to get your vehicle back.  If you refuse to pay, your vehicle will after 14 days be confiscated permanently and either sold or scrapped i.e. stolen from you again.  The fee increases daily.  It is unjust and unfair.

attributes.action: Centrally Fund a Tram or Underground for the Leeds-Bradford City Region
attributes.background: The West Yorkshire Urban Area is home to a population of approximately 2.3million people. If less wealthy countries are able to ensure their sizeable cities have mass transit systems, it should be of national concern that the UK, as the 9th wealthiest country in the world, is unwilling to do so.
attributes.additional_details: Any urban area within Europe of a similar size has either a tram, light rail, or underground network – some have two of the three. Examples include Turin, Prague, Vienna, Stockholm, Lyon, and our neighbours Manchester. HM Treasury figures show that London receives nearly £2600 per person in transport spending whereas Yorkshire and Humber receives £160. Transport for the North estimates the North is owed a £59 billion catch-up spend to bring our level of investment up to London spending.
